column3: Just as despair can come to one only from other human beings, hope, too, can be given to one only by other human beings.

There is hope in dreams, imagination, and in the courage of those who wish to make those dreams a reality.
We really feel happier when things look bleak. Hope is endurance. Hope is holding on and going on and trusting in the Lord.

The theological virtue of hope is the patient and trustful willingness to live without closure, without resolution, and still be content and even happy because our Satisfaction is now at another level, and our Source is beyond ourselves.
I hope for nothing. I fear nothing. I am free.
